alert.note: Alert for Southwest Desert, Lower Gila River Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 3:12PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Hidalgo County through 415 PM MDT... At 308 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Separ, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts 40 to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Steins, Lordsburg, Road Forks, Lordsburg Playa, Shakespeare and Pyramid Mountains. This includes Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 1 and 29, with blowing dust and visibilities down to 3 miles possible. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Southwest Desert, Lower Gila River Valley
